course.title: Introduction to Information Technology
course.catalogDescription: This course introduces students to the basic concepts of information technology relevant to all applications of computing. Upon completion, students will be well prepared to use computers to solve problems in other domains and pursue more advanced studies in computer science and cybersecurity. As part of the course, students will take the pre-professional ITF+ certification exam from CompTIA.

objectives.objective: Become conversant in basic IT terminology
Install basic computer peripherals and applications
Set up a basic wireless network
Configure and use a web browser to solve simple problems
Use programming logic to solve a simple problem
Understand the process of troubleshooting problems with hardware and software
Gain familiarity with common operating systems, operating system features, and user interfaces for operating systems
Become familiar with essential categories of software for a variety of tasks and how that software is licensed, deployed, and managed
Understand the basic concepts of popular programming languages, how programs are developed, and how they are executed on computers
Understand the basic concepts involved in database usage and management
Understand the basic principles of cybersecurity, particularly as they apply to users and every day computer use
Understand identity, password management, and data security concepts most important to users
Be able to apply best practices for cybersecurity in home, school, and professional contexts
